en: For his part, Mr Kan-Dapaah said political tolerance and consensus building remained critical ingredients for the social, economic and political advancement of the country.
twi: Mr Kan-Dapaah nso de too dwa sɛ, sɛ ɔman no bɛtu mpɔn a, ɛgyina sɛ amanyɔkuo ahodoɔ no rete wɔn ho ase so.

en: The Rt Hon. Scotland commended the people of Ghana for the peaceful manner in which they engaged in political discourse in the country, which she said was acknowledged by the entire Commonwealth family.
twi: Rt Hon Sɔotland bɔɔ Ghanafoɔ aba wɔ asomdwoeɛ kwan a wɔfaa so too aba wɔ ɔman no mu. ɛkyerɛ Commonwealthabusuakuo no ani gyee ho pa ara.

en: According to her, Ghana had historically led the way in democracy, which she said was "a heavy burden on the people’s shoulders, but it’s a burden that the people have carried with pride. We have always hoped in Ghana".
twi: ɔde too dwa sɛ, Ghana akɔ n’anim wɔ kabimamenkabi amammuo mu a ɔkyerɛɛ sɛ, “ɛyɛ adesoa a ɛda kuromma no so, nso saa kuromma no abɔ wɔn ho mmɔden yie. Yɛwɔ awerɛhyɛmu kɛseɛ wɔ Ghana mu.”

en: She, however, called for the inclusion of more women and the youth in policy formulation in the country.
twi: ɔsan nso de too dwa sɛ ɛyɛ mmaa ne mmabunu no de wɔn ho hyɛ ɔman no mmarahyɛ mu.

en: The Chairman of the NPC, Rev. Dr Ernest Adu-Gyamfi, said his outfit was working at strengthening mechanisms for inter- and intra-party dialogue to deepen trust and confidence in key state institutions responsible for elections.
twi: ɔtitenani a ɔda NPɔ ano, Rev. Dr. Ernest Adu-Gyamfi de too dwa sɛ, saa dwumadie yi de ayɔnkofa, gyidie ne awerɛhyɛmu mapa bɛba amanyɔkuo ahodoɔ no ntam ne ɔman nnwumakuo a ɛhwɛ abatoɔ so wɔ ɔman no mu ntam.

en: He expressed the hope that the issues discussed would significantly contribute to the healing of wounds created in the aftermath of the 2020 elections.
twi: ɔkyerɛ sɛ saa nkɔmmɔdie yi bɛboa ama wɔasiesie ɔhaw a aba 202 abatoɔ akyi no nyinaa.

en: The Chief Servant of Transeco Minerals and Mining, Mr. Godwin Amarh has constructed a six-unit classroom block at Akyem Ampapatia in the Atiwa West District of the Eastern Region.
twi: ɔpanin paa ɔda Transeco Mineral ne Mining ano, Mr. Godwin Amarh asi sukuu dan adampɔn nsia wɔ Akyem Ampapatia a ɛwɔ Atiwa West mansini a ɛwɔ Apueeɛ mantam mu.

en: The classroom block, estimated at a cost of GH¢295,000 forms part of the company’s Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR).
twi: ɔbɔɔ ka GH¢295,000 wɔ saa sukuu adan yi ho; na wei ka kɔmpɛne nhyehyɛeɛ ho sɛ wɔbɛboa ama wɔn atenaeɛ mu atu mpɔn.

en: Speaking at the inauguration, Mr Amarh underscored the need to give good and quality education to children at lower levels as it helps to give them strong foundation in education.
twi: Wɔrebue dan no ano no, Mr Amarh kyerɛɛ sɛdeɛ ɛhia sɛ mmɔfra a wɔwɔ mfiaseɛ sukuu mu bɛnya nwomasua mapa ɛsiane sɛ ɛboa ma wɔnya nwomasua mu fapem papa.

en: He said the role of education in every country’s development cannot be undermined, hence the reason his company prioritizes education.
twi: ɔde too dwa sɛ, wɔntumi ntoto nwomasua aseɛ wɔ kwa biara so ɛsiane sɛ ɔman no mpontuo gyina nwomasua so, nti ɛho hia sɛ kɔmpɛne no nso bɛma nwomasua ahia wɔn.

en: “We at Transeco Mining and Minerals Company have decided to ensure that children in communities where we operate are exposed to the best of teaching and learning environments at the lower levels of education. That is why we have made education a top priority on our corporate social responsibility.
twi: “Yɛn a yɛyɛ adwuma wɔ Transeco Mining and Minerals companyayɛ yɛn adwene sɛ, yɛbɛboa ama mfiaaseɛ sukuu nwomasua atu mpɔn wɔ baabibiara yɛn dwumakuo yi bi wɔ. Wei nti na dwumakuo ayɛ n’adwene sɛ ɔbɛboa ama nwomasua atu mpɔn wɔ baabi biara wɔwɔ.”

en: I’m excited to be back at Ampapatia to commission this school. We all know how important education is to the growth of individuals and the country. In order to have brilliant students at higher levels of education, they must first have a strong foundation that is why we have built this Kindergarten”, he said.
twi: ɔkaa sɛ, “ɛyɛ me dɛ sɛ maba Ampapatia na merebɛbue saa sukuu yi ano. Yɛn nyinaa yɛnim sɛdeɛ nwomasua ho hia ma nnipa ne ɔman no mpontuo. Sɛ yɛbɛnya asuafoɔ ama wɔaka sukuu aduruu akyire a, ɛwɔ sɛ wɔnya fapem mapa, na wei nti na ama yɛasi saa sukuu dan yi.”

en: Mr. Amarh said the school is also an appreciation to the chiefs and people of Ampapatia who have maintained a healthy relationship with the company since they started their operations in the community.
twi: Mr Amarh de kaa ho sɛ, sukuu dan no yɛ aseda a wɔde rema ahemfo ne nnipa a wɔwɔ Ampapatia mu a wɔne adwumakuo no anya nkitahodie mapa firi berɛ adwumakuo baa wɔn mpɔtam mu no.

en: Contrary to rumors and wild speculations that government has placed a ban on mining activities in the country, Mr. Amarh debunked the rumours and described it as not just inaccurate but false.
twi: Mr Amarh de too dwa sɛ ɛnyɛ nokorɛ sɛ aban no de taaboɔ ato maenen so wɔ ɔman no mu.

en: According to him, government has rather introduced new measures, policies and programmes aimed at making small scale mining productive and not destructive.
twi: ɔkyerɛ sɛ aban no mmom de nhyehyɛeɛ mapa aba sɛdeɛ maenen bɛtu mpɔn, na nyɛ sɛ ɔbɛgu no.

en: “Government has not banned activities of miners but rather categorized areas close to water bodies and forest reserves as red zones where no individual or company should mine. So what government is saying is that small scale miners should move away from the red zones. So anyone who does contrary to the directive by government will be dealt with by the laws of the country”, Mr. Amarh said.
twi: Mr Amarh kaa sɛ, “Aban mfaa taaboɔ ntoo maenen na mmom wɔkyerɛ beaeɛ ahodoɔ a ɛbɛn nsuo ne kwaeɛ no mu baabi a ɛnni kwan sɛ obiara kɔyɛ maenen dwumadie biara wɔ hɔ. Nti obiara a ɔbɛbu aban nhyehyɛeɛ yi so no, mmara ne no bɛdi.”

en: He therefore advised small scale miners to go work but ensure that they mine at designated areas.
twi: ɔtuu wɔn a wɔyɛ maenen adwuma no fo sɛ, wɔkɔtu maenen no na mmom wɔnyɛ no beaeɛ a wɔahyɛ wɔn no no.

en: Mr. Amarh who also doubles as the General Secretary of the Ghana National Association of Small Scale Miners (GNASSM) admonished members of the group to impact positively on communities where they have concessions.
twi: Mr Amarh a ɔsan nso yɛ ɔtwerɛtwerɛfoɔ Panin ma Ghana National associationof Small Sɔale Miners (GNASSMɔ de too ne kuomma anim sɛ wɔmmoa mma mpɔtam a wɔyɛ wɔn adwuma wɔ mu no ntu mpɔn.

en: He said small scale miners must work to change the narrative that they are destroyers who only take from communities and give nothing back.
twi: ɔde too dwa sɛ wɔn a wɔtu maenen no nsesa deɛ wɔka fa wɔn ho sɛ wɔsɛe mpɔtam ahodoɔ mu a mpɔtam no nnyaa hwee firi wɔn ho.

en: He said although many small scale miners are already doing that, there remains more to be done.
twi: ɔkyerɛɛ sɛ, maenenfoɔ no bi rebɔ wɔn ho mmɔden nso wɔbɛtumi ayɛ asene saa.

en: “Our sector employs a lot of people in communities where we operate. We must therefore work assiduously to leave a footprint. I know a lot of our members who have built schools and others have helped communities get electricity. We must push those stories out there to change the narrative that small scale miners only destroy’, he advised.
twi: ɔtoo fo sɛ, “Yɛn adwumakuo yi fa nnipa bebree wɔ mpɔtam ahodoɔ a yɛyɛ yɛn nnwuma no adwuma. ɛwɔ sɛ yɛyɛ adwumaden gya biribi papa to hɔ. Menim sɛ kuomma no dodoɔ no ara a wɔasisi sukuu adan na wɔaboa ma mpɔtam ahodoɔ anya anyinam ahoɔden. ɛwɔ sɛ yɛbɔ nsɛm yi ho dawuro ma nkorɔfoɔ sesa deɛ wɔka fa yɛn ho no.”

en: The Rebecca Foundation has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Abdul Samad Rabiu Africa Initiative (ASR Africa) for a grant of $500,000.
twi: Rebeɔɔa Foundation ne Abdul Samad Rabiu Africa Initiative (ASR Africa) de wɔn nsa ahyɛ kɔntraagye aseɛ a, sika a Rebeɔaa Foundation bɛnya yɛ $500,000.

en: The grant will be drawn from ASR Africa’s annual $100 million Africa Fund for Social Development and Renewal to support the Rebecca Foundation’s education initiative.
twi: Saa sika yi bɛfiri ASR Africa afe mu no nyinaa dwetire watwa to hɔ ama Africa Fund for SocialDevelopment and Renewal a ɛyɛ dɔla no, ɔpepem ɔha mu na ɛbɛba de aboa Rebeɔɔa Foundation nwomasua ho nhyehyɛeɛ.

en: Speaking at the meeting, the Managing Director of ASR Africa, Mr Ubon Udoh, commended the foundation for its commitment to the welfare of women and children in the country.
twi: ɔde n’anodisɛm reto dwan wɔ nhyiamu no ase no, ASR Africa adwuma no kwankyerɛfoɔ, Mr Ubon Udoh bɔɔ ekuo yi aba so sɛ wɔatu wɔn ho asi hɔ ama mmaa ne mmɔfra mpontuo.

en: He also praised the foundation for its adherence to good corporate governance and practices which have enabled the foundation to deliver infrastructure and services in the areas of education, health and women’s economic empowerment.
twi: ɔsan bɔɔ ekuo no aba wɔ sɛdeɛ wɔde amammuo mapa redi wɔn dwuma a aboa ama ekuo no reyɛ nnwuma bebree aboa ama nwomasua, apɔmmɔden nsɛm ne mmaa mpontuo rekɔ so.

en: "We did our homework and identified the Rebecca Foundation as one of the most reputable charities in Ghana, which encouraged ASR Africa to support the Rebecca Foundation.” he said.
twi: ɔkaa sɛ, “Yɛyɛɛ yɛn nhwehwɛmu hunuu sɛ Rebeɔɔa Foundation yɛ adɔeɛ kuo a wɔn anim wɔ nyam wɔ Ghana, na ɛhyɛɛ ASR Africa nkuran sɛ yɛmmɛboa wɔn.”

en: The Executive Director of the Foundation, Mrs Rebecca Akufo-Addo, thanked ASR Africa for the support to the foundation.
twi: Kwankyerɛfoɔ a ɔda Rebeɔɔa Foundation ano, Mrs Rebeɔɔa Akufo-Addo daa ASR Africa ase wɔ wɔn mmoa wɔde aboa ekuo no.

en: She pledged the commitment of the foundation to utilise the grant to benefit the education of children in the country.
twi: ɔhyɛɛ bɔ sɛ ekuo no de sika no bɛboa ama mmɔfra nwomasua atu mpɔn wɔ ɔman no mu.

en: The UK has denied involvement in the arrest and extradition of Nnamdi Kanu, who leads a banned group seeking a breakaway state in south-eastern Nigeria, where the ethnic Igbo people form the majority.
twi: UK aban no kyerɛ sɛ, wɔnnim Nnamdi Kanu a ɔdi nnipadɔm a wɔwɔ Nigeria anaafoɔ apueeɛ fam a Igbofoɔ ma wɔdɔɔso wɔ hɔ no kyere ne bɔ a wɔabɔ no aba Nigeria no ho hwee.

en: Mr Kanu, who holds British and Nigerian citizenship, was detained on Sunday with the help of Interpol and flown back to Nigeria, according to the attorney general.
twi: Aban lɔya panin kyerɛ sɛ, Interpol kyee Mr Kanu a ɔyɛ Britainni na ɔsan nso firi Nigeria Kwasiada de no baa Nigeria.

en: He faces treason-related charges in Nigeria, but fled the country in 2017 while on bail.
twi: Wɔde tirisin kwaadu bɔɔ no wɔ Nigeria wɔ 2017 mu nso wɔdwanee firii ɔman no mu berɛ a wɔmaa no beele.

en: There has been speculation that he might have been arrested in the UK, where it is believed he was mainly based.
twi: Wɔsusu sɛ wɔkyee no wɔn UK, beaeɛ a wɔgye di sɛ na ɔteeɛ.

en: “We can confirm that Nnamdi Kanu was not arrested in the UK for extradition purposes,’’ a British High Commission spokesperson told the BBC.
twi: British Haekɔmisa Kasamafoɔ de too BBɔ anim sɛ “Yɛbɛtumi aka sɛ wɔankye Nnamdi Kanu sɛ wɔde no rekɔ ne man mu.”

en: He is currently in the custody of Nigeria’s secret police after a brief court appearance on Tuesday.
twi: ɔkɔɔ kɔɔto Benada no; ɔwɔ Nigeria apolisifoɔ akakye.

en: His trial is expected to resume on 26 July.
twi: Wɔsan de no bɛkɔ akɔgyina mmara no anim wɔn Kitawonsa da a ɛtɔ so aduonu nsia.

en: The 53-year-old came to prominence in 2009 when he started Radio Biafra and broadcast to Nigeria from London, using the platform to call for Biafran independence and urging his followers to take up arms against the Nigerian state.
twi: Nnamdi Kanu gyee ne din wɔ 2009 mu berɛ a ɔhyɛɛ Radio Biafra adwuma ase wɔ London a na ɛba Nigeria. Sɛdeɛ wɔn a wɔte Biafra bɛnya wɔn fahodie nti, ɔde saa akwannya yi de too wɔn a wɔdi n’akyi no sɛ wɔtwetwe atuo wɔn Nigeria man no mu.

en: Five years later, he founded the Indigenous People of Biafra (Ipob), which has since been labelled a terrorist organisation by the Nigerian authorities.
twi: Mfeɛ num akyi no, ɔtee Indigenous People of Biafra (Ipobɔ a ayɛ atuatedɔm wɔn Nigeria aban no so.

en: Mr Kanu's initial arrest in 2015 triggered massive protests.
twi: Wɔdii kan kyee no wɔ 2015 mu no, ɛde ɔyɛkyerɛ bebree na ɛbaeɛ.

en: I was excited when I saw the Independence Square being renovated late last year.
twi: ɛyɛɛ me dɛ berɛ mehunuu sɛ wɔreyɛ nsiesie adwuma wɔ Independence Square afe a ɛtwam mu no.

en: The renovation, comprising painting and concrete works, was meant to prepare the Square for the funeral rites of former President Jerry John Rawlings.
twi: ɔmampanin dadaa John Jerry Rawlings ayie nti na wɔreyɛ nsiesie adwuma yi.

en: The Institute of Directors-Ghana (IoD-Gh) has commended the Bank of Ghana (BoG) for taking significant steps to promote good corporate governance in the country.
twi: Institute of Directors-Ghana (IoD-Gh) abɔ Bank of Ghana (BoG) aba so wɔ nhyehyɛeɛ mapa a wɔde agu akwan mu sɛdeɛ adwumakuo a wɔwɔ ɔman no mu ho bɛdwo wɔn.

en: It has also called for stronger collaboration between the institute and the bank to help promote proper governance of companies in the country.
twi: Wɔasrɛ sɛ wɔne Bank of Ghana bɛnya ayɔnkofa soronko a ɛbɛboa ama adwumakuo wɔwɔ ɔman no mu amammuo bɛtu mpɔn.

en: During a courtesy by the institute on the management of BoG, the President of IoD-Gh, Mr Rockson Kwesi Dogbegah, eulogised the Governor of the central bank, Dr Ernest Addison, for providing transformational leadership in reforming the financial services sector.
twi: Berɛ a wɔkɔsraa BoG manɛgɛmɛnt no, ɔpanin a ɔda IoD-Gh ano, Mr. Roɔkson Kwesi Dogbegah bɔɔ Bank of Ghana panin paa, Dr Ernest Addison no aba so wɔ n’amammuo papa ɔde abu sikasɛm akuo ahodoɔ wɔ ɔman no mu.

en: He said the effort by BoG led by Dr Addison had led to a vibrant and resilient banking sector.
twi: ɔkyerɛ sɛ BoG a Dr Addison da ano no aboa ma sikakorabea a ɛwɔ ɔman no mu ntotoeɛ atu mpɔn.

en: A statement from the institute said the visit was to commend the bank for its significant role in promoting the culture of good corporate governance in Ghana and to seek mutually beneficial relationships between BoG and the institute.
twi: Asɛm a adwumakuo mpaninfoɔ yi de too dwa fa deɛ nti a wɔkɔɔ BoG ne sɛ, wɔrekɔbɔ wɔn aba wɔ kwan a wɔafa so atoto adwumakuo ho ammmuo wɔ Ghana na wɔpɛ sɛ wɔne BoG ayɔnkofa no gyina pintinn.

en: Speaking on the strategic projects of the IoD-Gh, Mr Dogbegah said the IoD-Gh is developing a charter aimed at setting standards for the practice of corporate governance in Ghana.
twi: ɔrekasa afa nhyehyɛeɛ a IoD-Gh de agu akwan mu no, Mr Dogbegah kyerɛ sɛ IoD-Gh de nhyehyɛeɛ regu akwan mu sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ nnwumakuo mu amammuo bɛtu mpɔn wɔ ɔman no mu.

en: He indicated that the development of a national governance code was another key strategic project to be undertaken by the institute.
twi: ɔkyerɛ sɛ ɔman mu amammuo kɔɔdo nso yɛ nhyehyɛeɛ baako a wɔde regu akwan mu.

en: He disclosed that the institute had established the ongoing annual corporate governance excellence awards as part of its strategic efforts to celebrate the achievements of outstanding individual personalities and corporate organisations that have represented excellence in leadership and corporate governance and have made significant contributions to the socioeconomic development of Ghana.
twi: ɔdaa no adi sɛ afe biara no, wɔbɛbɔ nnipa ahodoɔ ne nnwumakuo a wɔn adwuma sɔ ani no wɔ nnwumakuo amammuo mu na wɔaboa ama mpontuo aba ɔman no mu aba so.

en: He added that the Institute, working in collaboration with key stakeholders, had championed the formation of the Ghana Association of Integrated Thinking and Reporting aimed at stimulating a strategic and sustainable way of value creation and reporting by organisations.
twi: ɔde kaa ho sɛ adwumakuo ne ne nnwumakuo ahodoɔ aka wɔn ho abɔm ate Ghana associationof Integrated Thinking and Reporting a ɛbɛboa ama nnwumakuo aba nyam.

en: BoG Governor stated that corporate governance played an important role in the financial sector.
twi: Panin paa ɔda BoG ano de too dwa sɛ nnwumakuo amammuo di akotene yie wɔ sikasɛm nnwumakuo mu.

en: According to him, corporate governance breaches, overbearing shareholder behaviour and related-party transactional breaches as some of the factors that led to the failure of some banks in the financial sector and their consequent resolution.
twi: ɔkyerɛ sɛ mmara a wɔbu so wɔn nnwumakuo amammuo mu, adwumayɛfoɔ no suban ne deɛ ɛkeka ho nyinaa na ɛmmoa ma sikakorabea ahodoɔ mfa wɔn ntoma pa mfira.

en: He reiterated the need for the Ghanaian society to uphold good corporate governance practices and pledged the bank’s support for the work of the institute, especially as events in the banking sector have a rippling effect on the Ghanaian economic sector.
twi: ɔde kaa ho sɛ, Ghanafoɔ mmoa na nnwumakuo amammuo mapa nkɔ so, na ɔde too dwa sɛ BoG nso bɛboa ama nnwumakuo no dwumadie atu mpɔn ɛsiane sɛ sikakorabea ahodoɔ no dwumadie nya nsunsuansoɔ wɔ ɔman no sikasɛm so.

en: Arteta must deliver next season
twi: Bɔɔlobɔ afe foforɔ a yɛbɛsi mu yi deɛ, ɛwɔ sɛ Arteta bɔ ne ho mmɔden.

en: As I have already mentioned, Arsenal do not intend to sack Mikel Arteta and the club management will back him to turn the Gunners around next season.
twi: Sɛdeɛ madi kan aka dada no, Arsenal yɛɛ n’adwene sɛ ɔbɛyi Arteta adi na wɔn a wɔda bɔɔlobɔ kuo no ano no taa n’akyi sɛ ɔbɛsesa nnoɔma afe a ɛda yɛn anim yi.

en: No one can say for certain if Arsenal have made the right decision but the club intends to bring in more talented players this summer.
twi: Obiara ntumi nkyerɛ sɛ deɛ Arsenal yɛɛ no kwan so ara no no, nso bɔɔlobɔ kuo de bɔɔlobɔfoɔ a wɔyɛ adeɛ bɛba bɔɔlobɔ kuo no mu.

en: Serious questions are being asked about the manager’s ability and even in his own dressing room players are looking at him and wondering if he is the right man for the job.
twi: Nnipa bebree na wɔrebisa sɛ, so Arteta bɛtumi ayɛ adwuma no anaa na bɔɔlobɔfoɔ a ɔne wɔn di dwuma no bisa wɔn ho sɛ so ɔbɛtumi ayɛ adwuma no anaa?

en: At 39 years-of-age Arteta has a reputation, built alongside Pep Guardiola, as a brilliant coach.
twi: Arteta ne Pep Guardiola yɛɛ adwuma gyee din sɛ kookyi a ɔbɔ ne ho mmɔden berɛ na wadi mfeɛ aduasa nkron.

en: However, after seventeen months in charge the fortunes of Arsenal have not progressed and many would argue that the team performances are inferior to those of Unai Emery, the man he replaced and who knocked him out of the Europa League.
twi: Nso Arsenal mmɔden te sɛ sɛdeɛ ɛteɛ no ara mfa ho sɛ wayɛ adwuma abosome du nson. Nnipa bebree reka sɛ bɔɔlobɔ kuo no mmɔden akɔ fam sene mmerɛ a na Unai Emery yɛ wɔn kookyi no, deɛ Arteta bɛdii n’adeɛ a ɔyii Arteta firii mu wɔ Europa League no mu.

en: Arteta captained Arsenal and was welcomed by the fans as their new champion but they are getting restless and agitated as they watch Chelsea and Tottenham move further ahead.
twi: Na Arteta yɛ Arsenal sahene na wɔn a wɔtae bɔɔlobɔ kuo bɔgyee ne so sɛ ɔno na ɔrebɛgye wɔn nanso ato wɔn awerɛhoɔ ne ayamhyehyɛ sɛdeɛ ɔhelsea ne Tottenham retwe wɔn mu si fa no.

en: The Super League disaster will not be forgotten for a long time
twi: ɛbɛkyɛ ansa na nnipa werɛ afi adeɛ a Super League no bɛyɛeɛ.

en: but I can tell you that the Kroenke owners are going nowhere
twi: Na mmom mɛtumi aka sɛ wɔn a Arsenal yɛ wɔn dea no, Kroenke abusua no nni baabi biara kɔ.

en: so it is up to Arteta to mend bridges, build a strong team and get his tactics right next season otherwise the proud Gunners could well crash and burn.
twi: Nti sɛ Arteta asɛdeɛ sɛ ɔbɛhyehyɛ bɔɔlobɔ kuo wɔyɛ nam yɛ hye na ɔbɛma mpontuo aba ne tActes mu bɔɔlɔbɔ afe a ɛda yɛn anim no mu. Anyɛ saa nnoɔma bɛtete apansam wɔ Arsenal bɔɔlobɔ kuo no mu.

en: De Gea won’t accept being No2
twi: De Gea nnye ntom sɛ ɔbɛyɛ abadiakyire.

en: Despite Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea having a contract until 2023 his agents are testing the waters to see which clubs would be interested in signing him.
twi: Manchester United gookipa, David De Gea n’anamusifoɔ rehwɛ sɛ ɔbɛtumi akɔtoa ne dwumadie no so wɔ bɔɔlobɔ kuo foforɔ mu a, mfa ho sɛ David De Gea nsa hyɛ kɔntraagye wɔ bɔɔlobɔ kuo no ase kɔsi 2023.

en: I am hearing from inside Old Trafford that despite being on good terms with current No1 Dean Henderson, De Gea will not sit back and accept a role on the bench for much longer.
twi: Nteeɛ a merete firi Old Trafford ne sɛ, mfa ho sɛ De Gea ne mprɛnprɛn gookipa a ɔdi kan, Dean Henderson ayɔnkofa yɛ no, De Gea ntena hɔ sɛ wɔma ntena nkyɛn aberɛ ɔmmɔ bɔɔlo no bi.

en: I am picking up interest from Atletico Madrid, Paris Saint Germain and Real Madrid.
twi: Manya no nteeɛ sɛ Atletiɔo Madrid, Paris Saint Germain ne Real Madrid nya no a, wɔpɛ.

en: The 30-year-old is arguably at the peak of his career although some inside the club believe he has declined slightly over the past two years.
twi: David De Gea a wanya mfeɛ aduasa aduruu baabi a ne bɔɔlobɔ wɔ soro wɔ ne bɔɔlobɔ adwuma no mu, ɛmfa ho sɛ nnipa no bi a wɔwɔ bɔɔlobɔ kuo no mu hunu sɛ ne mfeɛ mmienu ni na ne mmɔden aba fam.

en: Manager Solskjaer said, “Goalkeeper departments are a very tight knit group.
twi: Manigya Solskɛaer de ato dwa sɛ, “gookipafoɔ hɔ no ayɛ hyeehyeehye.

twi: Wɔsiesie wɔn ho, wɔn mu biara wɔ mmerɛ a wɔde kɔ gyem na wɔne bɔɔlobɔfoɔ no nyinaa nso yɛ trenin bɔm. Wɔn ntam nso yɛ kama.

en: Naturally they create a bond and the spirit in the goalkeeping department has been top.
twi: Ayɔnkofa soronko da wɔn ntam nti gookipafoɔ no dwumadie deɛ, dabiara ɛwɔ soro.

en: It’s a healthy competition.”
twi: Wɔboaboa wɔn ho wɔn ho ma wɔn mmɔdemmɔ tu mpɔn”

en: I am sure the coach is right however if De Gea doesn’t regain recognition for the No1 stitched onto the back of his shirt and is left on the bench in crucial games, I am reliably informed he will move out of Old Trafford.
twi: Megye di sɛ deɛ kookyi yi reka no yɛ nokorɛ nanso sɛ De Gea ammɛyɛ No 1 a, na woannya bɔɔlo no bi ammɔ a, manya no nteeɛ sɛ ɔbɛfiri Old Trafford.

en: I take West Brom to bounce back yet again

twi: West Bromwiɔh Albion asan afiri Premier League no mu afe pɛpɛɛpɛ a wɔbaa league no mu.

en: The key to yet another quick bounce back from the Championship will be whether or not fire-fighting manager Sam Allardyce can be persuaded to stay.
twi: Sɛ wɔbɛsan afiri Championship no mu aba Premier League no mu a, ɛgyina sɛ manigya Sam Allardyɔe bɛte aseɛ atena bɔɔlobɔ kuo no mu bio.

en: He is disappointed to have lost his reputation as never having been relegated with any club and the board at West Brom have a lot of work to do if they want to keep him.
twi: ɛnni n’abakɔsɛm mu sɛ ɔde bɔɔlobɔ kuo bi awe nti ɛyɛ no awerɛho sɛ saa animguaseɛ yi aba. Sɛ West Brom mpaninfoɔ pɛ sɛ ɔtenaa deɛ a, ɛnneɛ na wɔwɔ adwuma yɛ.

en: Ainsley Maitland-Niles, Conor Gallagher and Okay Yokuslu will return to their parent clubs after being on loan but Matheus Pereira, Callum Robinson, Hal Robson-Kanu and Karlan Grant can impress in the lower league.
twi: Ainsley Maitland-Niles, ɔonor Gallagher ne Okay Yokuslu bɛsan akɔ wɔn bɔɔlobɔ kuo a wɔde wɔn fem West Brom no mu bio ɛsiane sɛ wɔn mmerɛ aso sɛ wɔkɔ. Matheus Pereira, ɔallum Robinson, Hal Robson-Kanu ne Karlan Grant bɛtumi abɔ wɔn ho mmɔden wɔ Championship no mu.

en: Fastest man at City
twi: Onipa a ɔnim ammirika tu pa ara wɔ Manchester ɔity.

en: Who is the fastest player in the Manchester City squad?
twi: Hwan na ɔnim ammirika tu pa ara wɔ Manchester Citybɔɔlobɔ kuo no mu?

twi: Daabi, nyɛ Raheem Sterling.

twi: Manigya Pep Guardiola de trenen bi aba a bɔɔlobɔfoɔ biara gye bɔɔlo no to fam de kɔ ammirika bɛyɛ yaade du.

en: There are some very fast movers in the City squad but Gabriel Jesus proved he was the fastest.
twi: Wɔwɔ bɔɔlobɔfoɔ a wɔntumi de bɔɔlo no tu ammirika pa ara nso Gabriel ɛesus kyerɛɛ sɛ obiara nto no.

en: The best is yet to come from Havertz
twi: Havertz bɛtumi ayɛ asene deɛ ɔreyɛ yi.

en: Thomas Tuchel has been singing the praises of Kai Havertz and pointed to his two goals recently scored against Fulham.
twi: Thomas Tuɔhel rebɔ Kai Havertz aba so ɛwɔ ne ntena mmienu a ɔto tiaa Fulham no ho.

en: Tuchel recognises that since Kai arrived at Stamford Bridge from Bayer Leverkusen, things have not gone well for the German.
twi: Tuɔhel gye tom sɛ ɛfiri sɛ Kai firii Bayern Leverkusen baa Stamford Bridge no, nnoɔma nkɔmaa no sɛdeɛ ɔsi pɛ no no.

en: Moving from a foreign country and having to handle lockdown restrictions made things difficult and of course he caught Covid-19 and had to battle back to fitness.
twi: Worekɔ ɔman foforɔ mu na lɔkdaw ho nhyehyɛeɛ bebree nso wɔ hɔ maa nnoɔma yɛɛ den maa no. Afei nso ɔsan nso yɛɛ COVID-19 a ɛmaa n’ahoɔden kɔɔ fam

en: The upcoming Champions League final and the next pre-season, Tuchel believes, will show the best of the attacking midfielder and forward.
twi: Tuɔhel gye di sɛ, Champions League faenal ne bɔɔlɔbɔ afe a ɔda yɛn anim no na ɛbɛma yɛhunu ne mmɔdemmɔ.

en: Solskjaer is turning United into winners again
twi: Solskɛaer reboa ama United afa ne ntoma pa afira.

en: Manchester United might have big problems with the fans actively showing aggression towards the owners but inside the club there is a new belief, a new harmony and renewed confidence that they can achieve.
twi: Manchester United akyitaafoɔ ne wɔn bɔɔlobɔ kuo wɔ asɛm sɛ wɔhyɛ sɛdeɛ wɔn anim asi abre si fa a, nso bɔɔlobɔ kuo no mu deɛ wɔanya gyidie foforɔ, nkabom ne awerɛhyɛmu sɛ wɔbɛtumi abɔ wɔn ho mmɔden.

en: The man responsible is Ole Gunner Solskjaer and after speaking with many United staff and supporters this week, everyone recognises that it is time to praise the manager for achieving so much in the last eighteen months.
twi: Onipa a ɔreyɛ wei nyinaa ne Ole Gunner Solskɛaer na me ne United adwumayɛfoɔ ne wɔn akyitaafoɔ no bi dii nkɔmmɔ no, obiara ahunu sɛ mmerɛ aso sɛ wɔbɔ manigya no aba so wɔ nnoɔma a ɔde abosome du-wɔtwe ayɛ wɔ bɔɔlobɔ kuo no mu.

en: Solskjaer paved the way to sign Bruno Fernandes and Edinson Cavani and both have proven to be excellent additions to United’s line-up.
twi: Solskɛaer boa maa wɔde Bruno Fernandes ne Edinson ɔavani baa bɔɔlobɔ kuo no mu na wɔn mmɔdemmɔ nso asɔ ani yie.

en: Cavani has confirmed that he is staying for another season and it is mainly his belief in Solskjaer which has persuaded him.
twi: ɔavani de ato dwa sɛ ɔbɛtena bɔɔlobɔ kuo no mu afe baako aka ho na gyidie a ɔwɔ wɔ Solskɛaer mu na ama watena bɔɔlobɔ kuo no mu.

en: Paul Pogba looks settled and happy and his relationship with the manager is at an all-time high.
twi: Biribiara rekɔ yie ma Paul Pogba na n’ani nso gye. ɔne manigya no ayɔnkofa no nso yɛ.

en: When United fall behind in a matches these days, they get back up, fight and more often than not they win.
twi: Sɛ wo ne United resi akan nansa yi na sɛ wohyɛ wɔn a, wɔkeka wɔn ho na mpɛn pii no wɔbɛdi nkonim.

en: There is one thing to thank out-going Executive Vice-Chairman Ed Woodward for and that is allowing Solskjaer time to succeed in the job, survive the rough patches and turn his players into winners.
twi: Adeɛ baako a yɛde bɛbɔ ɔtitenani abadiakyire a ɔrekɔ, Ed Woodward aba so ne sɛ ɔmaa Solskɛaer tenaa bɔɔlɔbɔ kuo no mu ama wasesa nnoɔma ama bɔɔlobɔfoɔ no mmɔdemmɔ atu mpɔn.

en: Solskjaer is now the most important and the strongest foundation brick of the revitalised United and critics, staff and fans believe this is the beginning of a golden era for the Reds.
twi: ɛnam mmɔdemmɔ a Manchester United rebɔ nti, Solskɛaer abɛyɛ onipa a ne ho hia yie wɔ bɔɔlobɔkuo no mu. Wɔn a na wɔrebɔ n’akyi, adwumayɛfoɔ ne akyitaafoɔ no nyinaa gye di sɛ wei yɛ bɔɔlɔbɔ kuo mpagya ahyɛaseɛ.

en: Tell-tale sign
twi: Tɛɛl-teel sae

en: Kane thinking about leaving
twi: Kane pɛ sɛ ɔkɔ.

en: I noticed a significant silence during the match against Leeds at the weekend.
twi: Manhunu ne mmɔdemmɔ no so berɛ na wɔne Leeds United resi akan nnawɔtwe yi awieeɛ.

en: Harry Kane usually runs as much, if not more, than any other player and constantly barks out orders and instructions to other players to play more effectively.
twi: Harry Kane tu ammirika pa ara mpo sene bɔɔlɔbɔfoɔ a ɔne wɔn si akan no nyinaa; ɔkyerɛ deɛ n’afɛfoɔ no nyɛ wɔ agopramma no so sɛdeɛ wɔn dwumadie no bɛkɔ tɔɔtee.

en: Against Leeds he was very quiet and more so than I think I have ever seen him.
twi: Wɔne Leeds resi akan no, na ɔyɛ dinn a menhunuu no saa bi da.

en: I suspect this is a tell-tale sign that Harry is seriously doubting his tenure at Spurs and is already looking for a way out.
twi: Megye di sɛ wei yɛ adeɛ a ɛkyerɛ Harry pɛ sɛ ɔfiri Spurs bɔɔlɔbɔ kuo no mu, na ɔrehwehwɛ kwan a ɔbɛfa so.

en: Wolves desperate for a striker
twi: Wolves ani abere sɛ wɔbɛnya straeka.

en: Nuno Espirito Santos has at last recognised that during the transfer window he must prioritise signing a new striker.
twi: Nuno Espirito Santos ahunu sɛ afei deɛ ɛho bɛhia sɛ ɔbɛnya straeka wɔn bɔɔlɔbɔ kuo no mu.

en: Winger Pedro Neto and midfielder Ruben Neves are the leading scorers which pinpoints the weakness in Wolves strike force.
twi: Pedro Neto a ɔbɔ ntɛntɛnoa ne Reben Neves a ɔbɔ mfimfini na wɔato ntena bebree ama bɔɔlobɔ kuo no, na wei kyerɛ sɛ wɔn anim hɔ no nkɔ yie.

en: Fabio Silva and Raul Jimenez are next on the list however Jimenez has been out of action since November after fracturing his skull.
twi: Fabio Silva ne Raul Jimenez na wɔde wɔn akyi nso ɛnam pira nti, firi Obubuo bosome mu no, ɛimenez ntumi nsii akan.

en: Wolves have 13 goals less this season than last year.
twi: Wolves ntena a wɔtoo no afe a ɛtwaa mu no so ate du-mmiɛnsa.

en: The Wolves board have promised Nuno money to sign a proven goalscorer.
twi: Wolves manɛgemɛnt ahyɛ Nuno bɔ sɛ wɔbɛma no sika ama wɔde akɔto obi a ɔnim ntena toɔ.

en: Jimenez by the way will be told on May 18th if he is medically safe to play in the final two games of this season.
twi: Bosome a ɛtɔ so num no ne da a ɛtɔ so du-wɔtwe na ɛimenez bɛhunu sɛ ɔbɛtumi asi akan wɔ wɔn akansie mmienu ɛtwa toɔ no mu anaa.

en: He has been training for two months but was banned from heading the ball and having physical contact with his teammates.
twi: Wayɛ traenen bɛyɛ bosome mmienu nso wɔde taaboɔ ato ne sɛ ɔmmfa ne ti nka bɔɔl na afei nso ɔnni kwan sɛ ɔde ne ho ka wɔn a ɔne wɔn si akan no.

en: Sir Alex praises McTominay
twi: Sir Alex abɔ McTominay aba so.

en: When the great Sir Alex Ferguson speaks about Manchester United he is always worth listening to.
twi: Sɛ nipaa kɛseɛ bi te sɛ Sir Alex Ferguson kasa fa Manchester United ho a, ɛho hia sɛ wɔtie no.

en: His admiration for Scott McTominay is immense and the master says the midfielder should automatically play in every United game.
twi: N’ani agye Sɔott McTominay ho na ɔkyerɛ sɛ ɛwɔ sɛ ɔsi akan dabiara ma United.

en: “Scott McTominay is now emerging as one of United’s big players,” Sir Alex said.
twi: Sir Alex de too dwa sɛ, “Scott McTominay abɛyɛ bɔɔlobɔni kɛseɛ wɔ United mu”

en: “When you watch United pick their team for an important game, McTominay’s name is in it.
twi: “Sɛ wohwɛ wɔn a United de wɔn bɔ wɔn bɔɔlobɔ akɛseɛ no a, McTominay din wɔ mu.”

en: He’s a good character and a great trainer.
twi: ɛwɔ suban da na ɛba trene nso a, ɔbɔ ne ho mmɔden.

en: I signed him when he was just a kid of seven or eight years of age
twi: Mede no baa bɔɔlobɔ kuo no mu berɛ na ɔwɔ mfeɛ nson anaa nwɔtwe.

en: and he was actually a centre-forward.”
twi: Na na ɔyɛ straeka

en: What higher praise can a player receive.
twi: Abasobɔdeɛ kɛseɛ bɛn na ɛkyɛn wei.

en: Three astonishing football facts…
twi: Nwanwadeɛ ahodoɔ mmiɛnsa a asi wɔ bɔɔlobɔ mu...

en: *Manchester United have not lost an away game in the PL for a year and four months!
twi: Afe baano ne abosome nan nie, Manchester United nnii nkukuo wɔ Premier League akansie a wɔammɔ no wɔ wɔn fie da.

en: *If they do not win their next game, Sheffield United will become the first team since the 1904-05 season to have gone without winning two consecutive games.
twi: Sɛ wɔanni nkonim wɔ wɔn akansie a ɛda wɔn anim no a, Sheffield United bɛyɛ bɔɔlɔbɔ kuo a wɔdi kan a firi 1904-1905 bɔɔlɔbɔ afe mu a wɔnnii nkonim wɔ akansie mmienu mu ntoa so.

en: Dr Madzorera said the health ministry should also raise awareness about the disease, as well as make phone calls in all parts of the country so that people can call at any time to talk about the disease.
twi: Dr Madzorera de too dwa sɛ ɛwɔ sɛ asoeɛ a ɛhyɛ apɔmmuden nsɛm so ma yareɛ no dawuro dɔɔso, na afei nso wɔmma kwan ma nnipa frɛ wɔn wɔ tetefone sɛ wɔne wɔn bɛdi nkɔmmɔ afa yareɛ no ho ɛmfa ho ne baabi a wɔwɔ wɔ ɔman no mu.

en: They are also advocating for hygienic hygiene check-ups, rather than waiting for a suspected antibody to take them to the hospital.
twi: Wɔsan nso kyerɛ sɛ wɔnyɛ kyɛkap a ɛho teɛ sene sɛ wɔbɛtwɛn ama yareɛ no akye wɔn ansa na wɔakɔ ayaresabea.

en: Caps United chairman Lewis Uriri says they have resolved the problems facing their club and the striking players have begun preparations for their Castle Premier Soccer League matches.
twi: ɔaps United titenani, Lewis Uriri de ato dwa sɛ, wɔasiesie ɔhaw a ɛwɔ bɔɔlobɔ kuo no mu na bɔɔlɔbɔfoɔ a na wɔate atwea nyinaa asane aba reyɛ ahoboa wɔ wɔn akansie a wɔbɛsi wɔ ɔastle Premier Soɔɔer League no mu.

en: Speaking to Studio 7, Uriri said the players were given their outstanding bonus money.
twi: ɔne Studio 7 retwetwe nkɔmmɔ no, ɔde too dwa sɛ wɔatua bɔɔlɔbɔfoɔ sika a na akam no ama wɔn.

en: But he said last month's salaries would be paid to players soon. He also mentioned that there were some unnamed people who were influencing Caps United players to stop playing football.
twi: Nso ɔde too dwa sɛ bosome a atwam no akatua deɛ, ɛnkyɛ biara wɔde bɛma wɔn. ɔsan nso kyerɛɛ sɛ nnipa bi a wɔnnim wɔn din redaadaa ɔaps United bɔɔlɔbɔfoɔ no sɛ mma wɔnsi akan.

en: Uriri said he had spoken to the players and also said the reason for the delay in paying the players was that things were difficult for everyone in the country and that the real government had not paid last year's bonuses.
twi: Utiri de too dwa sɛ deɛn nti na na bɔɔlɔbɔfoɔ nsa nkaa wɔn akatua ne sɛ na nnoɔma mu ayɛ den ama obiara wɔ ɔman no mu, na na aban no mpo mfaa wɔn sika mmaa wɔn.

en: Sexual rights activists say abortion laws need to be amended to keep up with the times and to protect the lives of girls and women.
twi: Wɔn a wɔpere sɛ nsesaeɛ ba nnamusɛm ho kyerɛ sɛ, ɛwɔ sɛ wɔyɛ nsesaeɛ wɔ abɔɔhyin mmara na ɛne nnɛ mmerɛ mu abrabɔ no kɔ, na afei nso, ɛbɔ mmaayewa ne mmaa ho ban.

en: Sayendisa Ndlovu of SayWhat says the public is unaware of the abortion law and says it is important for the government to publicize the law.
twi: Sayendisa Ndlovu a ɔka SayWhat ho kyerɛ sɛ, nnipa a wɔwɔ ɔman no mu dodoɔ no ara nnim abɔɔhyin mmara no nti ɛwɔ sɛ aban no bɔ ho dawuro kyerɛ amansan.

en: Ndlovu told Studio 7 that it was important to amend the law as it was written long ago. He said the law needed to be amended to add other factors that could lead to a miscarriage.
twi: Ndlove de too Studio 7 sɛ ɛhia sɛ wɔyɛ nsesaeɛ wɔ abɔɔhyin mmara mu ɛsiane sɛ wɔtwerɛɛ saa mmara no akyɛ.

en: Ndlovu said such factors as mental illness, HIV / AIDS or disability were some of the factors that could be considered for abortion.
twi: Ndlove kyerɛ sɛ adwenem haw, HIV/AIDS ne dɛnnie bi na na ɛma ho kwan ma obi yɛ abɔɔhyin.

en: Ndlovu also explained that the law as it stands does not limit public hospitals to public abortion services and did not require a child nurse or doctor to abort a person legally.
twi: Ndlovu kyerɛɛ mu sɛ mmara no sɛdeɛ ɛteɛ no nsi ayaresabea biara ho kwan wɔ abɔɔhyin nhyehyɛeɛ ho na mmara ma ho kwan sɛ nɛɛse anaa dɔkota bi bɛyɛ abɔɔhyin.

en: Ms. Tendaishe Changamire, a civil rights activist under the Right Here Right Now program, has also called for the law to be amended to increase the risk of abortion.
twi: Ms. Tendaishe ɔhangamire a ɔpere nsesaeɛ wɔ ɔman mma fahodie ho nso de too dwa wɔ Right Here Right Now dwumadie so sɛ, ɛwɔ sɛ nsesaeɛ ba abɔɔhyin mmara no mu sɛdeɛ ɛbɛma abɔɔhyinyɛ so ate.

en: Ms. Changamire says many studies show that young girls are losing their lives through abortions.
twi: Ms ɔhangamire kyerɛ nhwehwɛmu da no adi sɛ, mmaa dodoɔ no ara na ɛnam abɔɔhyin nti, wɔhwere wɔn nkwa.

en: Although many young people are pushing for the law to be amended, some older women are opposed to it, saying abortion law should not make abortion more acceptable, saying it will make young people less respectful of life.
twi: ɛmfa ho sɛ mmabunu dodoɔ no ara pɛ sɛ wɔyɛ nsesaeɛ wɔ abɔɔhyin mmara mu no, mmaa mpaninfoɔ no bi nso mpene so. Wɔkyerɛ sɛ ɛnni kwan sɛ abɔɔhyin mmara no ma ho kwan ma wɔgye abɔɔhyinyɛ tom ɛfiri sɛ ɛmma mmabunu no mfa anidie mma nkwa.

en: The Termination of Pregnancy Act was enacted by a parliament in 1977 before the country gained full independence.
twi: Mmarahyɛbadwafie hyɛɛ abɔɔhyin mmara no wɔ 1977 mu ansa ɔman no renya ne fahodie.

en: Police have arrested several members of the MDC-T led by Nelson Chamisa as they tried to enter the party's Harare headquarters at Morgan Tsvangirai House.
twi: Apolisifoɔ akye MDC-T a Nelson ɔhamisa di wɔn anim no kuo mma no bi aberɛ a wɔyɛɛ sɛ wɔrewura amanyɛkuo no asoeɛ kɛseɛ a ɛwɔ Harere no mu wɔ Morgan Tsyangirai fie.

en: This came after the capture of the center by the MDC faction led by Ms Thokozani Khupe.
twi: Wei siiɛ berɛ kuo mma no bi a Ms Thokozani Khupe di wɔn anim no kɔfaa asoeɛ hɔ nɔɔnum.

en: Ms Khupe has been declared by the Supreme Court to hold office following Morgan Tsvangirai's death two years ago.
twi: Kɔɔto peemu ahyɛ sɛ Ms Khupe na ɔnni adeɛ ɛsiane sɛ na Morgan Tsyangirai afiri mu (wei si ne wuo no akyi mfeɛ mmienuɔ.

en: Police in custody include Chamisa's two deputies, Tendai Biti and Lynett Karenyi Kore, as well as David Chimhini, Lovemore Chinoputsa, Gladys Hlatywayo and others.
twi: Wɔn a apolisifoɔ akye wɔn ne ɔhamisa abadiakyire mmienu, Tendai Biti ne Lynett Karenyi Kore. David ɔhimhini, Lovemore ɔhinoputsa, Gladys Hlatywayo ne wɔn a wɔkeka ho nso ka ho bi.

en: The detainees were said to be on their way to the party's headquarters, where they were surrounded by armed police.
twi: Wɔkyerɛ sɛ na wɔn a wɔkye wɔn no nam kwan so rekɔ amanyɔkuo no asoeɛ kɛseɛ hɔ na apolisifoɔ kɔkyeree wɔn.

en: Studio7 has not been able to hear from the police how many people have been arrested, and what charges have been leveled against them as police spokesman Paul Nyathi was not answering his phone.
twi: ɛsiane sɛ na wɔfrɛ apolisifoɔ kasamafoɔ, Paul Nyathi wɔ tetefone so a wɔnnya no nti, Studio 7 nnyaa nteeɛ biara mfiri apolisifoɔ no hɔ ɛfa nnipa dodoɔ ankasa a wɔakye wɔn no ho ne kwaadu a wɔde abɔ wɔn.

en: Chamisa's MDC spokesperson, Fadzai Mahere, said he was shocked by the arrests.
twi: ɔhamisa MDɔ kasamafoɔ Fadzai Mahere de too dwa sɛ ɛyɛ no nwanwa sɛ wɔakyere wɔn.

en: The situation in the MDC is tense following a Supreme Court ruling this year that ruled that Chamisa and Ms Khupe's congresses were unconstitutional, and that Congress should be held at a time when Ms Khupe is the caretaker incumbent.
twi: Kɔɔto peemu de too dwa afe yi mu sɛ, ɔhamisa ne Khupe nyinaa amammuo nni mmara kwan so na mmom mmarahyɛbadwafoɔ no nhyia na Ms Khupe na ɛbɛtoto nnoɔma. Wei ama deɛ ɛrekɔ so wɔ MDɔ mu no ano ayɛ den.

en: Following the ruling, Ms Khupe fired four members of parliament and the senate, saying the people were no longer representing the interests of their party.
twi: Kɔɔto peemu de asɛm yi too dwa ara pɛ na Ms Khupe yii mmarahyɛbadwafoɔ anan adi; ne sɛn nti ho ne sɛ nyɛ amanyɔkuo no mpontuo nti na saa nnipa yi wɔ hɔ.

en: Dismissed are Thabitha Khumalo, Prosper Mutseyami, Lilian Timveous and Charlton Hwende.
twi: Wɔn a wɔyii wɔn firii mmarahyɛbadwafie ne Thabitha Khumalo, Prosper Mutseyami, Lilian Timveous ne ɔharlton Hwende.

en: Some Zimbabweans in various countries say they were forced to leave the country because of the rule of Robert Mugabe, who they say is ruling with an ax.
twi: Zimbabwefoɔ bi a wɔwɔ aman foforɔ mu de ato dwa sɛ, Robert Mugabe amammuo na ɛhyɛɛ wɔn maa wɔfirii ɔman no mu. Wɔkyerɛ sɛ na ɔde nsa den na ɛrebu ɔman no.

en: A political scientist who teaches at Bergen University in Norway, and a member of the Zimbabwe Yibuya / Mayibuye Zimbabwe organization, Dr Victor Chimhutu, says that although Mr Mugabe was seen as a champion of African unity, one Zimbabwean family did not view him that way.
twi: Amanyɔsɛm kyerɛkyerɛni a ɔkyerɛ adeɛ wɔ Bergen University wɔ Norway na ɛka Zimbabwe Yibuya/Mayibuye kuo ho, Dr Viɔtor ɔhimhutu kyerɛ sɛ, ɛwɔ mu sɛ Mr Mugabe adi akotene wɔ Abibiman nkabm ho nanso abusua baako wɔ Zimbabwe a wɔnhunu no sɛdeɛ obiara si hunu no si fa.

en: Dr Chimhutu says Mr Mugabe's alliance with other African leaders is one of the reasons he has gained so much respect from African leaders.
twi: Dr ɔhimhutu kyerɛ sɛ Mr Mugabe ayɔnkofa a ɔne Abibiman mpaninfoɔ bi wɔ yɛ sɛn nti nti no mu baako a ɛma saa Abibiman mpaninfoɔ yi de obuo maa Mugabe.

en: They say Mr. Mugabe will also be remembered for insulting and expressing his views on the West and his criticism of the leaders of countries such as the United States and Britain.
twi: Wɔkyerɛ sɛ wɔbɛkae Mugabe ɛnam n’adapaatwa ne n’adwenkyerɛ a na ɔkyerɛ sɛ Mmɔroɔfo ho ne sɛdeɛ na ɔsi ka aman mpaninfoɔ a wɔwɔ aman bi te sɛ United States ne Britain anim si fa.

en: Mr Mugabe allegedly did not beat the dogs and hid the culprit if members of his Zanu PF party defected, or even insulted opposition parties.
twi: Sɛ obi wɔ Mugabe Zanu amanyɔkuo no mu na ɔyɛ deɛ ɛntene anaa ɔkasa tia wɔn a wɔnni aban mu a, wɔtwe n’ankasa kuo mma no anim.

en: Mr Mugabe is expected to be laid to rest on Sunday, although his whereabouts have not yet been announced.
twi: Wɔde Mr Mugabe bɛto mpa mu Kwasiada ɛmfa ho sɛ wɔmfaa baabi a ɔwɔ ntoo dwa.

en: Doctors and nurses working in public hospitals have told the government they will stop working at the beginning of next month if they are not paid before the end of December.
twi: Adɔkotafoɔ ne nɛɛsefoɔ a wɔreyɛ adwuma wɔ aban ayaresabea de ato aban no anim sɛ, ɔpɛnimma bosome no kɔ awieeɛ na sɛ aban no antuaa wɔn ka a, wɔde wɔn mfidie bɛgu hɔ bosome a ɛdi yɛn anim yi ahyɛaseɛ.

en: The president of the Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors Association, Fortune Nyamande, who said his organization was affiliated with the Zimbabwe Nurses Association, had written a letter to the government informing them of the move.
twi: Onipa a ɔda Zimbabwe dɔkotafoɔ kuo ano, Fortune Nyamande a ɔkyerɛ sɛ Zimbabwe anɛɛsefoɔ kuo no nso hyɛ wɔn ase no atwerɛ lɛtɛ de akɔma aban no wɔ deɛ wɔpɛ sɛ wɔyɛ no ho.

en: Dr Nyamande said he had written to the government informing him of his strike from January 1 next year.
twi: Dr Nyamande kaa sɛ watwerɛ lɛtɛ abɔ aban no amanneɛ ɛfa wɔn atuatie a ɛrehyɛ aseɛ ɔpɛpɔn da a ɛdi kan wɔ afe foforɔ no mu.

en: They say they and nurses in government hospitals have taken this step on the grounds of lack of transportation costs as they have not yet received their monthly salaries as well as bonus payments promised by the government.
twi: Wɔkyerɛ sɛ wɔne anɛɛsefoɔ a wɔwɔ aban ayaresabea na ɛredi saa dwumadie yi ɛsiane sɛ wɔnni sika wɔde bɛfa lɔɔre akɔ adwuma, ɛfiri sɛ wɔn akatua ne sika bi a aban no hyɛɛ wɔn bɔ sɛ ɔde bɛma wɔn no aka mu.

en: Dr Nyamande also criticized the government's alleged use of the media to discredit traditional newspapers.
twi: Dr Nyamande san nso twee aban no anim wɔ sɛ ɔde kwasafo dawubɔ rekata deɛ dawubɔ nkrataa de ato dwa no so.

en: Finance Minister Patrick Chinamasa has already announced that the government will not be able to pay some of its employees this year due to a lack of funds.
twi: ɔsoafoɔ a ɔhwɛ sikasɛm so, Patrick Chinamasa dii kan de bɛtoo dwa sɛ aban no ntumi ntua adwumayɛfoɔ bi ka afe yi mu ɛsiane sɛ sika nni hɔ.

en: "Mr Chinamasa has used the newspapers to announce the change in our pay dates, so we will use the same methods," Dr Nyamande said.
twi: Dr Nyamande se, “Owura Chinamasa faa koowa nkrataa so bɔɔ dawuro faa nsesaeɛ a aba akatua mmerɛ no mu, nti yɛbɛfa saa kwan no ara so.”

en: The coaches, who were due to receive their pay on Monday, have been announced on Tuesday, but the general public, including doctors and nurses, are expected to receive their pay on January 5 next year.
twi: Koogyifoɔ a na ɛwɔ sɛ wɔnnya wɔn akatua Dwoada no nsa aka wɔn akatua ma wɔbɔ ho dawuro Benada yi. Nanso wɔn a wɔyɛ aban adwuma te sɛ adɔkotafoɔ ne anɛɛsefoɔ deɛ, wɔbɛtua wɔn ka afe a ɛda yɛn anim yi, ɔpɛpɔn da a ɛtɔ so num.

en: But many civil servants who spoke to Studio 7 said they were not confident they would get their money back on the new deadlines.
twi: Nanso aban adwumayɛfoɔ pii a wɔne Studio 7 twetwee nkɔmmɔ no kyerɛ sɛ wɔnni gyidie sɛ wɔn nsa bɛka wɔn akatua mmerɛ a wɔahyɛ no.

en: We have not been able to contact the Minister of Health, David Parirenyatwa, and the Minister of Labor, Priscah Mupfumira, to find out what steps they will take to prevent a strike.
twi: Yɛntumi ne apɔmmuden soafoɔ, David Parirenyatwa ne apaadie soafoɔ, Prisɔah Mupfumira nnii nkɔmmɔ mfa kwan a wɔbɛfa so asi atuateɛ no ano.

en: The main opposition MDC party has complained that its members are being harassed by the police.
twi: MDɔ amanyɔkuo a ɛnni aban mu abɔ apolisifoɔ kwaadu sɛ wɔreteetee wɔn kuo mma.

en: The Zimbabwe Lawyers for Human Rights says 47 people have been arrested in recent days, mostly MDC supporters and seven other students at Allen Wilson School in Harare for allegedly protesting illegally.
twi: Zimbabwe mmaranimfoɔ a wɔko ma nnipa yiedie de ato dwa sɛ, nnipa aduanan nson na wɔakye wɔn nansa yi a dodoɔ no ara yɛ MDɔ akyitaafoɔ, ɛnna nson yɛ asuafoɔ a wɔkɔ sukuu wɔ Allen Wilson a ɛwɔ Harare sɛ wɔreyɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ a yɛmmaa wɔn kwa.

en: Other detainees include Makomborero Haruzivishe, a former student leader from ZINASU, who appeared in court today, along with his colleague Allan Moyo.
twi: Afoforɔ binom a wɔakye wɔn ne Makomborero Haruzivishe, kane suani kannifoɔ a ɔfiri ZINASU a ɔbaa kɔɔto nnɛ ne ne yɔnko Allan Moyo.

en: We were unable to reach the police spokesperson, Assistant Commissioner Paul Nyathi, as their phone was unanswered.
twi: Yɛantumi ne apolisifoɔ kasamafoɔ Assistant Commissioner Paul Nyathi atwe nkɔmmɔ ɛfiri sɛ na wamfa ne tetefon ne yɛakasa.

en: Lawyer Innocent Gonese, the MDC's legal adviser, said Haruzivishe and Moyo would return to court on Monday to discuss the court's decision.
twi: Lɔya Innoɔent Gonese a ɔyɛ MDɔ lɔya kyerɛ sɛ, Haruzivishe ne Moyo bɛpuem wɔ kɔɔto Dwoada na wɔakɔ dwenedwene kɔɔto no agyinatuo no ho.

en: The United Nations World Health Organization (WHO) has declared China that the corona virus, which has killed 233 people in China, has become a global epidemic.
twi: United Nations World Health Organization (WHOɔ ada no adi sɛ Corona virus kodiawuo a akum nnipa ahannu ne aduonu mmiɛnsa wɔ ɔhina no abɛyɛ amansan nyinaa adesoa.

en: In the last two days alone, about 2,000 people are estimated to have been infected with the corona virus and 9,800 have been infected worldwide in 244 countries.
twi: Nna mmienu ni, nnipa 2000 na wɔkyerɛ sɛ wɔanya Corona virus , na wiase mu nyinaa nso nnipa 9800 na wɔanya bi wɔ amn ahannu ne aduonan nan.

en: WHO chief Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said that while they were confident of China's efforts to prevent the disease, they feared that if it spread to other parts of the world, it could kill more people.
twi: WHO krakye panin, Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebrevesus de berɛ na wɔwɔ gyidie sɛ ɔhina bɛyɛ deɛ ɔbɛtumi ayɛ biara asɔ yareɛ no ano no, na wɔsuro sɛ yareɛ no bɛtrɛ akɔ aman foforɔ mu. ɛbɛtumi akum nnipa bebree.

en: Health Minister Dr Obadiah Moyo says Zimbabwe is testing more than 200 people from China or countries with a corona virus infection.
twi: Apɔmmuden soafoɔ, Dr. Obadiah Moyo kyerɛ sɛ Zimbabwe de nnipa a wɔboro ahannu a wɔfiri ɔhina ne aman ahodoɔ so na afa mfidie mu ahwɛ sɛ, so wɔwɔ Corona virus anaasɛ wɔnni bi.

en: People under investigation in Zimbabwe are being held at their home for 14 days.
twi: Nnipa a wɔreyɛ wɔn ho nhwehwɛmu wɔ Zimbabwe rehyɛ wɔn dan mu nnawɔtwe mmienu.

en: Former health minister Dr Henry Madzorera says Zimbabwe needs more money to prevent the spread of the disease.
twi: Apɔmmuden soafoɔ dadaa, Dr Henry Madzorera de too dwa sɛ Zimababwe hia sika pii a wɔde bɛsi yareɛ yi ano na antrɛ.

en: The body of former president Robert Mugabe will arrive in Harare on Wednesday afternoon and his funeral will be announced.
twi: ɔmampanin dadaa Robert Mugabe amu bɛduru Harare Wukuada awia na wɔde da wɔbɛyɛ n’ayie no bɛto dwa.

en: This was announced by the Minister of Information, Ms Monica Mutsvangwa, after a cabinet meeting.
twi: Dawubɔ soafoɔ, Ms Moniɔa Mutsvangwa de asɛm yi too dwa berɛ a kabenɛt nhyiamu baa n’awieeɛ.

en: Ms Mutsvangwa said government committees were preparing for Mr Mugabe's funeral.
twi: Mr Mutsvangwa de too dwa sɛ aban no agyinatuo reboaboa wɔn ho ama Owura Mugabe ayie no.

en: Asked why it was taking so long to talk about Mugabe's funeral, Mutsvangwa and Foreign Affairs Minister Sibusiso Moyo said it was "unusual" that he would announce his funeral arrangements after the Mugabe family in Singapore arrived in the country.
twi: Wɔbisaa wɔn sɛ deɛn nti akye ansa na wɔrekasa afa Mugabe ayie no hɔ a, Mutsvangwa ne amannɔne soafoɔ Sibusiso Moyo de too dwa sɛ, “ɛnyɛ ne kwan so sɛ wɔbɛka berɛ a wɔbɛyɛ n’ayie berɛ a n’abusuafoɔ da so wɔ Singapore.”

en: He said the government and President Mugabe's family were working together.
twi: ɔse aban no ne ɔmampanin Mugabe abusuafoɔ redi nsawɔsoɔ.

en: Meanwhile, King Katizagombo's spokesman, Gibson Jenami, said there was no longer any controversy over Mugabe's funeral as the government, led by Emmerson Mnangagwa, was at the forefront of the process.
twi: ɔhene Katizagombo kasamafoɔ, Gibson ɛenami kyerɛ sɛ ntawantawa biara nni Mugabe ayie no ho ɛsiane sɛ Emmerson Mnangagwa aban no na biribiara hyɛ wɔn nsa.

en: Meanwhile, Major General Trust Mugoba, who also passed away last week, will be laid to rest on Wednesday at the Heroes Acre burial ground in Harare.
twi: Wɔbɛsie Maɛor General Trust Mugoba a ɔfirii mu nnawɔtwe a ɛtwaa mu no Wukuada wɔ Heroes Acre burial ground a ɛwɔ Harare.

en: In other news, the government says 178 Zimbabweans have been affected by the violence in South Africa and that two Zimbabweans have died in the violence.
twi: Nsɛm foforɔ mu no, aban no kyerɛ sɛ Zimababwefoɔ ɔha ne aduoson-nwɔtwe na wɔn ho aka wɔ South Africa ɛnam basabasaeɛ a ɛrekɔ so no, na Zimbabwefoɔ baanu na wɔahwere wɔn nkwa.

en: Moyo said the government was planning to bring the victims home with the bodies.
twi: Moyo de too dwa sɛ aban no de nhyehyɛeɛ regu akwan mu sɛ wɔde wɔn a wɔafiri mu no amu bɛba fie.

en: The government also claims that health workers, including doctors, have been paid an additional 60 percent of their benefits, and today the cabinet has decided that the health and finance ministry will sit down to ensure that the workers are paid fairly.
twi: Aban no san nso kyerɛ sɛ, wɔatua apɔmmuden adwumayɛfoɔ te sɛ adɔkotafoɔ ɔham nkyɛ mu aduosia wɔ wɔn adwuamayɛ ho. ɛnnɛ na kabenɛt no ayɛ n’adwene sɛ wɔbɛhyia apɔmmuden ne sikasɛm asoeɛ no na wɔatena ase ahwɛ sɛ wɔatua adwumayɛfoɔ ka sɛdeɛ ɛsɛ.

en: Health Minister, Dr Obadiah Moyo, has said he will sit down with the finance ministry to ensure that the cabinet resolution is implemented.
twi: Apɔmmuden soafoɔ, Dr Obadiah Moyo de too dwa sɛ ɔne asoeɛ a wɔhwɛ sikasɛm so no bɛtena ase ahwɛ sɛ wɔbɛyɛ deɛ kabinɛt agye atom no.

en: Doctors went on strike last week complaining that their salaries were too low.
twi: Adɔkotafoɔ de wɔn mfidie guu fam nnawɔtwe a ɛtwaam no sɛ wɔn akatua nso.

en: An organization formed to commemorate human rights activists and former Occupy Africa Unity Square leader Itai Dzamara, the Itai Dzamara Trust, today celebrated International Women's Day.
twi: Ekuo a wɔate sɛ wɔde hyɛ Itai Dzamara a na ɔko ma nnipa yiedie na ɔsan nso yɛ Oɔɔupy Africa Unity Square kannifoɔ dadaa animuonyam, Itai Dzamara Trust kaeɛ International Women’s Day nnɛ.

en: The ceremony was held in Highfield where women and girls who attended the event were provided with follow-up equipment or sanitary pads and more.
twi: Dwumadie yi kɔɔ so wɔ Highfield na wɔmaa mmaa a wɔbaa dwumadie no ase no paade ne deɛ ɛkeka ho.

en: A spokesman for the Dzamara family who is also a member of the board of the Itai Dzamara Trust, Mr Partson Dzamara, told Studio 7 that he saw fit to show love to women this month, the month of his brother Itai's disappearance five years ago.
twi: ɔkasamafoɔ ma Dzamara abusua no a ɔsan nso ka Itai Dzamara Trust bɔɔdo no ho, Mr Partson Dzamara de too Studio 7 anim sɛ ɔhunu no sɛ ɛwɔ sɛ ɔkyerɛ dɔ kyerɛ mmaa saa bosome no mu; mfeɛ nnum a ne nuabarima firii yeraa wɔ saa bosome no mu.

en: He said although his brother was involved in politics, human rights and journalism, he did it all out of love and the Itai Dzamara Trust will continue to be kind to him.
twi: ɔse ɛwɔm sɛ ne nuabarima no de ne ho hyɛɛ amanyɔsɛm, nnipa yiedie ne dawubɔ adwuma mu, na ɔyɛɛ wie nyinaa wɔ ɔdɔ mu; na Itai Dzamara Trust bɛtoa ne nnwuma pa no so.

en: He said his organization had launched its operation in the village of Highfields because it was the birthplace of Itai but said they would go elsewhere to help women and the poor with knowledge and experience in many areas including law, education and health.
twi: ɔkyerɛ n’adwumakuo no aba Highfields ɛfiri sɛ ɛhɔ na wɔwoo Itai na mmom wɔbɛkɔ mmeaeɛ ahodoɔ akɔboa mmaa ne wɔn a wɔnni bi wɔ mmara, nnwomasua ne apɔmmuden mu.

en: Among the participants in today's event was Rememberance Zuze, who said that although Mr Dzamara had not yet been found, he was happy with the actions of the organization that monitors his life.
twi: Wɔn a wɔbaa dwumadie no ase mu baako ne Remeberanɔe Zuze a ɔde too dwa sɛ, mfa ho sɛ wɔnhunuu Owura Dzamara no, n’ani agye dwumadie a ekuo no redi ho.

en: An unnamed girl told Studio 7 that she has benefited a lot today.
twi: Abaayewa a wammɔ ne din de too Studio 7 anim sɛ, wasua nnoɔma bii wɔ nnɛ dwumadie no mu.

en: Meanwhile, Partson Dzamara has announced that a five-year anniversary rally for his brother abducted by unknown individuals in Glen View will be held on Tuesday in Harare.
twi: Partson Dzamara daa no adi sɛ, wɔbɛyɛ nkaedum de akae ne nuabarima a nkorɔfoɔ bi kyee no wɔ Glen View Benada wɔ Harare.

en: He said so far they did not know the whereabouts of his brother or whether he was alive.
twi: ɔkyerɛ sɛ, seisei deɛ wɔnnim baabi a ne nua no wɔ anaasɛ ɔte ase mpo a.

en: He said police, human rights activists, the Zimbabwe Human Rights Commission and others who worked with Itai Dzamara were among those invited to the event.
twi: ɔde too dwa sɛ, wɔn a wɔne Itai Dzamara yɛɛ adwuma te sɛ polisifoɔ dwumakuo, nnipa a wɔpere nnipa yiedie, Zimbabwe Human Rights Commission ne afoforn na wɔbɛto wɔn nsa afrɛ wɔn.

en: As the world celebrates refugee day, tomorrow, some Zimbabweans living as refugees in South Africa say there is nothing to celebrate as South Africa is in dire straits.
twi: Sɛ wiase nyinaa redi atukɔtenafoɔ da kyena no, Zimbabwefoɔ a wɔyɛ atukɔtenafoɔ wɔ South Africa deɛ, biribiara nni hɔ sɛ wɔdi ahurisie ɛnam nnoɔma bɔne a ɛrekɔ so wɔ South Africa no.

en: Some Zimbabweans say South Africa does not respect the agreements it has signed with organizations such as the United Nations in respecting the rights of refugees.
twi: Zimbabwefoɔ no bi se South Africa mmu nhyehyɛeɛ wɔne akuo bi te sɛ United Nations sɛ wɔde obuo bɛma atukɔtenafoɔ no so.

en: The secretary general of the Zimbabwe Migrant Support Network, Shelton Chiyangwa, told Studio 7 that although refugee day is important, South African refugees are being held hostage.
twi: ɔtwerɛtwerɛfoɔ panin a wɔwɔ Zimbabwe Migrant Support Network, Shelton ɔhiyangwa, de too Studio 7 anim sɛ ɛmfa ho sɛ atukɔtena da no ho hia no, atukɔtenafoɔ a wɔwɔ South Africa deɛ, wɔwɔ nkoasom mu.

en: Chiyangwa said the Zimbabwean family living in South Africa was also the main victims.
twi: ɔhiyangwa kaa sɛ Zimbabwefoɔ a wɔwɔ South Africa nso na wɔreteetee wɔn.

en: He added that his organization was working with Zimbabweans and other countries to help them obtain travel documents
twi: ɔde kaa ho sɛ n’adwumakuo ne Zimbabwefoɔ ne aman afoforɔ di dwuma pɛ nkrataa ma wɔn.

en: Zimbabwe Exemption Permits vice-chairwoman Gladys Mangwende said her organization was interested in the refugee awareness program but was concerned about the lack of human rights.
twi: Zimbabwe Exemption Permits krakye panin, Gladys Mangwende de too dwa sɛ, n’adwumakuo n ani di atukɔtenafoɔ awɛɛnes nhyehyɛeɛ ho nanso n’ani nso di ankorɛankorɛ yiedie nso wɔnni soɔ no so.

en: The chairman of Human Rights Watch in North Africa, Dewa Mavhinga, says refugee day is important in South Africa as there are many Zimbabweans living as refugees.
twi: ɔtitenani ma Human Rights Watɔh a ɛwɔ North Africa, Dewa Mavhinga se atukɔtenafoɔ da no ho hia wɔ South Africa ɛsiane Zimbabwefoɔ atukɔtenafoɔ a wɔwɔ ɔman no mu no nti.

en: Mr Mavhinga went on to urge the South African government to relax the rules, especially in the area of ​​immigration.
twi: Owura Mavhinga toaa so sɛ South Africa aban no ngu mmara no mu ne titire ne akwantuo mu.

en: Another Zimbabwean, George Manyika, also backed Mavhinga's statement.
twi: Zimbabweni, George Manyika nso foaa Mavhinga asɛm no so.

en: Gabriel Shumba, head of the Zimbabwe Exiles Forum, has called on the United Nations, the AU and SADC to take a closer look at the treatment of refugees by SA, especially Zimbabweans.
twi: Gabriel Shumba a ɔda Zimbabwe Exiles Forum ano de ato United Nations, AU ne SADɔ anim sɛ wɔmma wɔn ani nkɔ nnoɔma a ɛrekɔ so wɔ South Africa no, ne titire ne Zimbabwefoɔ a wɔwɔ ɔman no mu.

en: The Lions also appealed to South Africa's interior minister, Aaron Motseledi, to relax his department's rules so that refugees do not have to struggle to obtain documents.
twi: Lions de dwanetoa kɔtoo South Africa amandwoeɛ soafoɔ, Aaron Motseledi anim sɛ ɔngu wɔn mmara sɛdeɛ atukɔtenafoɔ mmrɛ ansa wɔn nsa aka wɔn nkrataa.

en: He urged human rights groups to work with his organization to fight for the rights of all refugees.
twi: ɔsrɛɛ nnipa yiedie kuo ahodoɔ sɛ wɔne ne dwumakuo no nka mmɔ na wɔnkɔ ma atukɔtenafoɔ yiedie.

en: One of the refugees, Francis Mukono, said he did not see the importance of refugee day as the situation in South Africa was difficult.
twi: Atukɔtenafoɔ no mu, Francis Mukono de too dwa sɛ, wanhunu mfasoɔ a ɛwɔ atukɔtena day no sɛ ɛnam asetena a wɔtem wɔ South Africa no.

en: Another refugee, Steven Chiweshe, also said he was unaware of the stabbing.
twi: Atukɔtenafoɔ foforɔ, Steven Chiweshe nso de too dwa sɛ wanhunu sɛ wɔde sekan rewɔ obi.

en: Mandela Madumise, South Africa's director general of refugee affairs, said his department had applied to the United Nations Human Rights Council for assistance in resolving the problems they were facing in the department.
twi: Mandela Madumise, South Africa krakye panin pa ara ɔhwɛ atukɔtenafoɔ nsɛm so kyerɛ sɛ n’asoeɛ no de ato United Nations Rights Council no anim sɛ wɔmmɛboa wɔn na wɔsi ɔhaw ahodoɔ a asoeɛ no refam no ano.

en: Madumise said by the end of next month, his department would know what needs to be done to address these issues.
twi: Madumise kyerɛ sɛ bosome no nkɔ awieeɛ no, n’asoeɛ no bɛhunu de ɛwɔ sɛ wɔyɛ si ɔhaw yi ano.

en: It is estimated that more than three million Zimbabweans have fled South Africa to South Africa, accusing the government of harassment.
twi: Wɔkyerɛ sɛ Zimbabwefoɔ bɛyɛ mpem mmiɛnsa na wɔafiri South Africa a wɔkyerɛ sɛ aban no retiatia wɔn fahodie so.

en: But the Zimbabwean government says some people have fled to the countryside in search of better pastures.
twi: Nanso Zimbabwe aban no se nnipa binom atu kɔ aman foforɔ so wɔrekɔpɛ adwuma papa bi ayɛ.

en: Hospital staff, including nurses and doctors, have been on strike for more than 33 days, saying their salaries were not enough to go to work without any hope of a solution.
twi: Wɔn a wɔyɛ adwuma wɔ ayaresabea a anɛɛsefoɔ ne adɔkotafoɔ ka ho ano de wɔn mfidie agu hɔ bɛyɛ nna aduasa mmiɛnsa a wɔkyerɛ sɛ wɔn akatua no so, na wɔmfaa hwee ngu akwan mu sɛ wɔreyɛ biribi afa ho.

en: The situation in public hospitals is tense, with some patients being sent home without treatment.
twi: Deɛ ɛrekɔ so ayaresabea ahodoɔ mu no ano ayɛ den. Wɔde wɔn a wɔyare no resan akɔ fie ɛsiane sɛ wɔnnya ayarehwɛ.

en: The situation in hospitals is expected to worsen as the Senior Health Doctors Association has already announced that if the financial issues and strikes of the junior and senior doctors are not resolved by them they will also go on strike. Spokesman for the medical association Dr Aaron Musara told Studio 7 that things were not going well in the hospitals.
twi: Nnoɔma bɛsɛe asene sɛdeɛ nnoɔma teɛ no ɛsiane sɛ Senior Health Doctors associationnso sɛ wɔnyɛ biribi amfa adɔkotafoɔ yɛkyerɛ ne wɔn akatua no ho a, wɔn nso de wɔn mfidie bɛgu hɔ. Kasamafoɔ ma ekuo yi, Dr. Aaron Musara de too Studio 7 anim sɛ nnoɔma nkɔ yie wɔ ayaresabea hɔ.

en: Dr Musara said although he had informed the government of his intention to step down through letters to various departments, he had not received a response.
twi: Dr Musara kaa sɛ ɛmfa ho sɛ watwerɛ krataa akɔma aban no asoeɛ ahodoɔ abɔ wɔn amanneɛ sɛ ɔbɛsi fam afiri n’akonnwa no so no, ɔnnyaa mmuaeɛ biara.

en: Nurses in public hospitals are not going to work and are demanding that the government pay them their salaries with the US money they received in October 2018 as well as provide them with equipment to protect themselves from illness when they are on duty.
twi: Anɛɛsefoɔ a wɔwɔ aban ayaresabea nso nkɔ adwuma, na wɔse aban no nyi Amerikafoɔ sika a wɔde brɛɛ no Ahinime wɔ 2018 no mu bi ntua wɔn ka. Afei nso sɛ wɔkɔ adwuma a, ɔmma wɔn akadeɛ mfa mmɔ wɔn ho ban mfiri yadeɛ no ho.

en: The president of the Zimbabwe Nurses Association, ZINA, Enock Dongo, says talks with the government are a goat's head.
twi: Enoɔk Dongo a ɔyɛ Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors associationkannifoɔ se wɔne aban ne nkɔmmɔ nkɔsii hwee.

en: Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors Association (ZHDA) spokesperson Dr Tapiwa Mungofa also said that the lack of access to health care services by the government has left patients without treatment.
twi: Zimbabwe Hospital Doctors association(ZHDA) kasamafoɔ, Dr Tapiwa Mungofa nso kyerɛ sɛ ɛsiane sɛ aban no mma adɔkotafoɔ no nkɔ ayaresabea nti, wɔn a wɔyare no nnya ayarehwɛ.

en: Mr Mungofa also said that at the time the children's nurses went on strike, many of their members were at home as a precautionary measure against the transmission of COVID-19 to self quarantine.
twi: Owura Mungofa de too dwa sɛ mmerɛ a anɛɛsefoɔ a wɔhwɛ mmɔfra de wɔn mfidie guu hɔ no, wɔn adwumayɛfoɔ no dodoɔ no ara tenaa fie sɛ wɔrebɔ wɔn ho ban na wɔanya COVID-19.

en: Studio 7 was unable to hear the government's side of the story to address the grievances of health workers as former health minister Professor Amon Murwira was unresponsive to his phone call.
twi: Studio 7 antumi ne aban no antwetwe nkɔmmɔ anhunu kwan a wɔbɛfa so asiesie saa ɔhaw yi ɛsiane sɛ ɔsoafoɔ a na ɔhwɛ apɔmmuden so, ɔbenfoɔ Amon Murwira ntumi wɔn akasa wɔn tetefon so.

en: But last week, Mr Murwira announced that he had started a conversation with a nurse. His deputy John Mangwiro also told Studio 7 that they were too busy to speak.
twi: Nnawɔtwe a ɛtwaa mu no, Owura Murwira de too dwa sɛ ɔne nɛɛse baako ahyɛ aseɛ retwetwe nkɔmmɔ. N’abadiakyire John Mangwiro nso de too Studio 7 anim sɛ adwuma gu wɔn so pa ara nti wɔnti ne wɔn nkasa.

en: Chairman of the Health Services Board, Dr. Paulinus Sikosana, also said they had been in a meeting on the COVID-19 epidemic and were therefore unable to speak to us.
twi: ɔtitenani ma Health Services Board, Dr Paulinus Sikosana nso kyerɛ sɛ wɔreyɛ nhyiamu fa COVID-19 kodiawuo no ho nti wɔntumi ne yɛn ntwetwe nkɔmmɔ.

en: Health experts also say that if the government does not address the issue of nurses returning to work and also preventing pediatricians from continuing to set themselves on fire, especially now that the country is facing the COVID-19 epidemic that has killed 25 people so far.
twi: Apɔmmuden animdefoɔ nso kyerɛ sɛ ɛwɔ sɛ aban no yɛ biribi ma anɛɛsefoɔ ba adwuma na wɔnasi anɛɛsefoɔ a wɔhwɛ mmɔfra sɛ wɔredi wɔn ho dɛm ano berɛ a ɔman wɔ ahohiahia mu ɛsiane COVID-19 kodiawuo a ama nnipa aduonu num ahwere wɔn nkwa no.

en: Chinhoyi City Council says it is ready to comply with the High Court's ruling on Monday that the council should rebuild buildings that it demolished in the city.
twi: ɔhinhoyi CityCouncil kyerɛ sɛ wɔayɛ ahoboa sɛ wɔbɛdi deɛ kɔɔto de too dwa Dwoada sɛ kansere no nsisi adan a wɔabubu agu wɔn kurom hɔ no.

en: Speaking at a meeting with traders who had their buildings demolished by the Chinhoyi council, the council's secretary, Abel Gotora, said they would abide by the court's order for the council to build commercial buildings which had been demolished by some traders.
twi: Kansere no twerɛtwerɛfoɔ, Abel Gotora ne adwadifoɔ a ɔhinhoyi kansere abubu wɔn adan retwetwe nkɔmmɔ no, ɔde too dwa wɔbɛdi deɛ kɔɔto ahyɛ kansere no sɛ wɔnsi adan a adwadifoɔ no bi abubu no no.

en: But Mr Gotora said the council would not rebuild all the buildings it had demolished, but would only build the buildings that the high court had ordered for the six people who took the council to court.
twi: Nanso Owura Gotora kaa sɛ kansere no nsi adan a wɔbubu no no nyinaa, na mmom wɔbɛsi deɛ haekɔɔto hyɛɛ wɔn sɛ wɔnsi ma nnipa baasia a wɔde wɔn kɔɔ kɔɔto no.

en: Tafadzwa Marimo, Emmanuel Ngwaru, Richard Svosve, Pepukayi Marega and Devis Shopo were among those who took Chinhoyi to court.
twi: Tafadwa Marimo, Emmanuel Ngwaru, Richard Svosve, Pepukayi Marega ne Devis Shopo ka wɔn a wɔde kansere no kɔɔ kɔɔto no ho bi.

en: One of the six, Emmanuel Gwaru, said he accepted the court ruling with great joy as the government had told the councils to clean up the area only, not demolish buildings.
twi: Saa nnipa baasia yi mu baako, Emmanuel Gwaru de too dwa sɛ n’ani gyee atemmuo a kɔɔto no de baeɛ no ho ɛsiane sɛ aban ka kyerɛɛ kansere no wɔ wɔnsiesie mpɔtam hɔ, na wanka nkyerɛ wɔn sɛ wɔmmubu adan.

en: Mr Gwaru said one of his biggest grievances was that he was paying money for the council to build better commercial facilities. Gadzema Councilor Patricia Chibaya said she was pleased with the court's decision as she was in a difficult situation because, on the other hand, as a councilor, she had to comply with a letter from provincial minister July Moyo to clean up the cities, but at the same time. they also sympathize with the people who live by the trade whose markets have been destroyed.
twi: Owura Gwaru sɛ deɛ baako a ɔdi ho haw kɛseɛ pa ara ne sɛ ɔtua sika ma kansere no sɛ wɔmfa nsisi adan. Gadzema kansela Patricia ɔhibaya se n’ani gyee kɔɔto no atemmuo no hɔ ɛsiane sɛ na ɛyɛ no den sɛ ɔbɛdi deɛ mpɔtam hɔ soafoɔ hyɛɛ no sɛ ɔmmubu adan wɔ kurom hɔ. Mmerɛ korɔ no ara no nso, wɔmaa wɔn a adwadifoɔ a wɔabubu wɔn adan wɔ dwam hɔ hyɛden.

en: Mr Gotora announced that the council would build a new market for 50 traders at the Gadzema market.
twi: Owura Gotora de too dwa sɛ kansere no bɛsi dwam foforɔ ama adwadifoɔ aduonum wɔ Gadzema dwom hɔ.

en: A spokesperson for the Zimbabwe Lawyers for Human Rights, Kumbirai Mafunda, said traffickers were coming to their offices seeking legal representation.
twi: Kasamafoɔ ma Zimbabwe Lawyers for Human Rights, Kumbirai Mafunda se nnansa yi terafikɛs reba wɔn ɔfese wɔmmɛka wɔn nsɛm ma wɔn.

en: Many councils in the country are demolishing buildings that they say were built illegally.
twi: Kansere pii a ɛwɔ ɔman no mu rebubu adan a wɔamfa mmara kwan so asi no gu.

en: But traders in various parts of the world are protesting in court what their councils are doing.
twi: Na mmom adwadifoɔ a wɔwɔ wiase afanaa nyinaa rekɔ kɔɔto sɛ deɛ kanserefoɔ no reyɛ no nyɛ.

en: Following the Supreme Court ruling on Tuesday as to who should lead the MDC party since the death of Morgan Tsvangirai, many people want to know who the real owner of the Richard Morgan Tsvangirai House or Harvest House is.
twi: Kɔɔto peemu de n’atemmuo bɛtoo dwa Benada fa deɛ ɔnni MDɔ amanyɔkuo no anim ɛsiane sɛ Morgan Tsvangirai ahwere ne nkwa no, nnipa dodoɔ no ara rebisa sɛ hwan ankasa na Richard Morgan Tsvangirai anaa Harvest House yɛ no dea.

en: The court ruled that Ms Thokozani Khupe should take over the reins of the MDC-T until an election is held within three months.
twi: Kɔɔto no de too dwa sɛ Awuraa Thokozani Khupe nni MDC-T anim kɔpem sɛ wɔbɛto aba bosome mmiɛnsa ntam.

en: But the issue of who enters the party's headquarters is a bit difficult as there are two people guarding the building, namely Ian Makone and Reverend Tim Neil, a former head of the Church of the Province of Central Africa or CPCA.
twi: Na mmom nnipa a wɔbɛkɔ amanyɔkuo no asoeɛ kɛseɛ mu no ayɛ den kakra ɛsiane nnipa baanu a wɔredi dwuma wɔ hɔ a wɔn din ne Ian Makone ne Reverend Tim Neil (na ɔda Church of the Province of Central Africa anaa ɔPɔA anoɔ.

en: The secretary general of the MDC Alliance, Charlton Hwende, believes that the center is in the hands of the two and that they are currently the only ones allowed to use it.
twi: MDɔ Alliance twerɛtwerɛfoɔ panin, Charlton Hwende gye di sɛ saa nnipa baanu yi na asoeɛ hɔ hyɛ wɔn nsa na wɔn nko ara na wɔbɛtumi akɔ hɔ.

en: Douglas Mwonzora, who also claims to be the party's secretary general, has returned to the party in 2014. He also believes that the party is in the hands of Makone and Neil.
twi: Douglas Mwonzora a ɔkyerɛ sɛ ɔyɛ amanyɔkuo no twerɛtwerɛfoɔ panin a ɛbaa amanyɔkuo no mu wɔ 2014 nso kyerɛ sɛ amanyɔkuo no hyɛ Makone ne Neil nsa.

en: But they said they think they will be allowed to work in you. We have not been able to contact Mr. Makone and Mr. Niel to hear their side of the story.
twi: Na mmom wɔse wɔgye di sɛ wɔmma wɔn kwa ma wɔkɔyɛ adwuma wɔ hɔ. Yɛntumi ne Owura Makone ne Owura Neil ntwetwe nkɔmmɔ ntie wɔn nso ano asɛm.

en: The deputy chairperson of the MDC led by Nelson Chamisa, Job Sikhala, says the St Marys area in Chitungwiza has given birth to leopards which is prompting party supporters to flee their homes and seek refuge.
twi: MDɔ ɔtitenani abadiakyire, ɛob Sikhala kyerɛ sɛ asebɔ aba St Marys a ɛwɔ ɔhitungwiza mpɔtam a ama amanyɔkuo no akyitaafoɔ redwane afiri wɔn afie mu.

en: Sikhala, a former Zengeza West MP, said his party's supporters were being sought by a senior police officer named Jabangwe in the area for his arrest.
twi: Sikhala a na ɔyɛ Zengeza West mmarahyɛbɛdwani kyerɛ sɛ polisi ɔfesa a wɔfrɛ no ɛabangwe repɛ amanyɔkuo no akyitaafoɔ akye wɔn.

en: We tried to contact Mr. Jabangwe but he did not want to answer our questions.
twi: Yɛbɔɔ mmɔden sɛ yɛne Owura ɛabangwe bɛtwetwe nkɔmmɔ nso na ɔmpɛ sɛ ɔyi sɛ nsɛmmisa no ano.

en: Studio7 was also unable to hear from a police spokesman. Assistant Commissioner Paul Nyathi, why the supporters want to be arrested by the police.
twi: Studio 7 antumi ne apolisifoɔ kasamafoɔ, Assistant Commissioner Paul Nyathi ntwetwe nkɔmmɔ anhunu deɛ nti a polisini yi pɛ sɛ wɔkye akyitaafoɔ yi.

en: But it is alleged that the issue of arrests of MDC supporters was aimed at protesting the party's nationwide protests.
twi: Na mmom ayɛ atesɛm sɛ kye a wɔpɛ sɛ wɔkye MDɔ akyitaafoɔ asekyerɛ ne sɛ wɔpɛ sɛ wɔgyae ɔyɛkyerɛ a wɔayɛ wɔn adwene sɛ wɔbɛyɛ no wɔ aman no nyinaa mu.

en: Sikhala, who was arrested last month on charges of plotting to overthrow the government of Emmerson Mnangagwa, told Studio 7 that many people were fleeing their homes for fear of arrest.
twi: Sikhala a wɔkyee no bosome a ɛtwaa mu a soboɔ a wɔde bɔɔ no ne sɛ ɔpɛ sɛ ɔtu Emmerson Mnangagwa aban gu no de ato Studio 7 anim sɛ, nnipa dodoɔ no ara na wɔredwane afiri wɔn afie mu ɛsiane sɛ wɔsuro sɛ wɔbɛkye wɔn.

en: More than 90 people were arrested in Harare last Friday in connection with a protest organized by the MDC on the same day.
twi: Nnipa boro aduokron na wɔkyee wɔn wɔ Harare Fiada ɛsiane ɔyɛkyerɛ a MDɔ yɛeɛ saa da no.

en: The MDC wants to protest in major cities in the country but the police are using part of the Public Order and Security Act to ban the party from continuing its protests.
twi: MDɔ pɛ sɛ wɔyɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ wɔ kuropɔn a ɛwɔ ɔman no mu nanso apolisifoɔ de Public Order ne Seɔurity Actno mpɛ sɛ amanyɔkuo no bɛtoa ɔyɛkyerɛ no so.

en: Police have so far banned the MDC from protesting in Harare, Bulawayo, Gweru and Masvingo.
twi: Apolisifoɔ no de taaboɔ ato MDɔ so sɛ mma wɔnyɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ wɔ Harare, Bulawayo, Gweru ne Masvingo.

en: Political analysts say this could also happen in Mutare where the MDC plans to hold a protest on Thursday.
twi: Amanyɔsɛm mpɛnsɛmpɛnsɛmufoɔ kyerɛ sɛ wei nso bɛtumi asi wɔ Mutare a MDɔ ayɛ wɔn adwene sɛ wɔbɛyɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ wɔ hɔ da Yawoada no.

en: The High Court has suspended Justice Minister Ziyambi Ziyambi and Finance Minister Mthuli Ncube from funding the MDC-T led by Thokozani Khupe under a parliamentary budget law.
twi: Haekɔɔto agyina mmarahyɛbadwafie mmara fa aban afe sikasɛm ntotoeɛ ho atu ɔsoafoɔ a ɔhwɛ atetenee so Ziyambi Ziyambi ne ɔsoafoɔ a ɔhwɛ sikasɛm so, Mthuli Nɔube asɛm ɛsiane sɛ wɔn na wɔbɔɔ MDC-T a Thokozani Khupe da ano no dwetire.

en: High Court Judge Priscilla Munangati Manongwa ruled on Thursday that she had suspended Ziyambi and Ncube from presenting the MDC-T faction, which claims to be the legitimate party, to fund political parties under parliament under the Political Parties (Finance) Act.
twi: Haekɔɔto temmuafoɔ, Priscilla Munangati Manongwa de too dwa Yawoada no sɛ wɔtu Ziyambi ne Nɔube asɛn na wɔntumi nnyina MDC-T anan mu, ɛsiane wɔkyerɛ sɛ Amanyɔkuo Sikasɛm Mmara ma wɔn ho kwan ma wɔbɔ amanyɔkuo dwetire.

en: The MDC is due to receive R7,500 million in RTGS.
twi: Na MDɔ nsa bɛka R7,500M wɔ RTGS mu.

en: Experts say Nelson Chamisa's MDC has gone to court after Ms Khupe's faction had written letters to banks seeking to remove Chamisa's members from the list of people who were required to sign statements to withdraw money from the party's Steward Bank.
twi: Animdefoɔ se Nelson ɔhamisa MDɔ kɔɔ kɔɔto berɛ Awuraa Khupe afa no twerɛ nkrataa kɔɔ sikakorabea sɛ wɔreyi ɔhamisa akyitaafoɔ afiri wɔn a wɔtumi sae ma wɔyi sika firi amanyɔkuo no sika wɔ Steward Bank no mu.

en: Chamisa's MDC-T deputy spokesman, Luke Tamborinyoka, said he was happy with the ruling.
twi: Luke Tamborinyoka a ɔyɛ ɔhamisa MDC-T kasamafoɔ abadiakyire de too dwa sɛ n’ani agye atemmuo no ho.

en: But Morgen Komichi, who has been claiming to be the party's chairman following a Supreme Court ruling that ruled that Chamisa had not complied with his party's constitution to become MDC leader, said he would take steps to get the money as he was the party's official leader.
twi: Nso Morgen Komiɔhi a ɔkyerɛ sɛ ɔyɛ amanyɔkuo no kannifoɔ de too dwa sɛ, ɔde nhyehyɛeɛ bɛgu akwan mu akɔgye sika ɛsiane sɛ ɔn na ɔyɛ amanyɔkuo no kannifoɔ (ne sɛ nti ne sɛ kɔɔto peemu de bɛtoo dwa sɛ ɔhamisa amfa amanyɔkuo anni mmara a ɛwɔ amanyɔkuo no mmara kunini so nti ɔnni ho kwan sɛ ɔdi amanyɔkuo no animɔ.

en: But Mr Tamborinyoka said he was entitled to the money as the MDC MPs entered parliament using his name.
twi: Nso Owura Tamborinyoka se ɔhamisa bɛtumi agye sika no bi ɛfiri sɛ MDɔ mmarahyɛbadwafoɔ faa nam ne din so na wɔkɔɔ mmarahyɛbadwafie.

en: But Komichi said Mr Chamisa and others should abide by the law.
twi: Nanso Komiɔhi kaa sɛ ɛwɔ sɛ ɔhamisa ne afoforɔ no di mmara no so.

en: Meanwhile, a Harare lawyer, Kudzai Kadzere, said the court's decision could be appealed within 10 days.
twi: Nanso so, Harare mmaranimni, Kudazi Kadzere kaa sɛ wɔbɛtumi adwane atoa agyinaeɛ a wɔsii no wɔ asɛnnibea no nnafua du ntam.

en: Ziyambi told Studio7 by telephone that they could also file their papers in court within 10 days if they want to challenge the ruling as ordered by the court.
twi: Ziyambi ka kyerɛɛ studio 7 wɔ ahomatorɔfoɔ so sɛ wɔbɛtumi ato nkyea wɔ nsɛm a asɛnnifoɔ no hyɛeɛ wɔ nnafua du ntam.

en: We have not been able to speak to the Speaker of Parliament, Jacob Mudenda, or the Minister of Finance to hear his side of the story as he has also been named in the court papers.
twi: Yɛntumi ne ɛaɔob Mudenda a ɔyɛ mmarahyɛbadwafie tetini ne ɔsaofoɔ a ɔhwɛ sikasɛm nkae ntie wɔn nso asɛm ɛsiane sɛ wɔn din wɔ asɛnnie krataa mu no.

en: Some legal experts say the provisional order was issued by the court to the nominees that if they did not object to Chamisa's MDC case, the court could fulfill its decision to transfer the money to Chamisa's MDC.
twi: mmaranimfoɔ bi nso de kyerɛ sɛ wɔamfa wɔn nsɛnkae ama a ɛkyerɛ sɛ wɔnnye asɛm no ntom mu a, kɔɔto no de sika no bɛma ɔhamisa MDɔ.

en: This is not the first time the MDC has fought for these funds.
twi: 6.Wei nyɛ da a edi kan MDɔfoɔ reko sika yi ho.

en: In 2006, after former MDC secretary general Welshman Ncube opposed Morgan Tsvangirai in October 2005 and formed his own MDC, he continued to receive all the MDC funding for the parties, leaving Mr. Tsvangirai, the majority party in parliament, without a single penny.
twi: Ɛwɔ afe 2006 mu no, akyire yi a MDɔfoɔ twerɛtwerɛfoɔ panin Welshman Nɔube ko tia Tsuangirai wɔ Ahinime bosome a ɛwɔ 2005 mu na ɔtee n'ankasa MDɔ. }kɔɔ so gyee sika a na ɛfiri MDɔ kuo no hɔ,maa Mr. Ysvangirai a ɔda dɔm dodoɔ ano wɔ mmarahyɛbadwafie annya sika biara.

en: Another Zimbabwean, Dr Rita Nyampinga, of the Female Prisoners Support Trust, which fights for women's rights in prisons, said she was happy to receive the 2020 International Women of Courage Award.
twi: Zimbabweni, Dr Rita Nyampinya a ɔka Female Prisoners Suport Trust a wɔko ma mmaa wɔ fiase kaa sɛ n’ani agye sɛ ɔnyaa 2020 International Women of ɔourage Award no.

en: The award recognizes the heroic deeds of women around the world, and is presented by the United States Department of International Relations.
twi: Abasobɔdeɛ yi kae nnwuma pa a mmaa wɔwɔ wiase afanaa yɛeɛ na United State Dpartment of International Relation na wɔde abasobɔdeɛ yi ma.

en: Dr Nyampinga said she never thought she would receive such an honor, saying she was thrilled to be recognized along with 11 other women from around the world.
twi: Dr Nyampinga kaa sɛ wanna annwene ho da sɛ ɔbɛnya saa abasobɔdeɛ yi, na ɔkaa sɛ ɛyɛ no anigye pa ara sɛ yɛbɛkan ano aka mmaa dubaako a wɔfiri ewiase afanaa nyinaa ho.

en: Dr Nyampinga says they will be traveling to various parts of the United States to learn about prison conditions so that they can strengthen their work at home.
twi: Dr Nyampiga kaa sɛ wɔbɛtu kwan akɔ afiase ahodoɔ a ɛwɔ United State akɔsua sɛdeɛ afiase hɔ tebea sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a wɔbɛtumi amia wɔn ho ayɛ wɔn adwuma wɔ man mu..

en: Dr Nyampinga says their work requires courage and they are happy that others have seen the work they are doing back home.
twi: Dr Nyampinga kaa sɛ wɔn adwuma no hia akokoɔduro na afei nso wɔn ani agye sɛ afoforɔ ahu wɔn nnwuma a wɔreyɛ.

en: Speaking at the event, Secretary of State for International Relations Michael Pompeo said the work done by the 12 women is admirable and requires courage.
twi: Berɛ a ɔkasa wɔ dwabɔ no ase no, ɔtwerɛfoɔ ma State of International Relations, Miɔhael Pompeo kaa sɛ adwuma a mmaa dummienu yi ayɛ yɛ anisɔ na ɛhia akokoɔduru.

en: The program was launched 14 years ago.
twi: Wɔpaa dwumadie yi ho ntoma wɔ mfirihyia dunan a abɛsene kɔ mu.

en: Other women who have received this award are from Afghanistan, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bolivia, Burkino Faso, Kazakhstan, Malaysia, Nicaragua, Pakistan, Syria, Yemen and Zimbabwe.
